knowledge.heading: Social Persecution and Otherness
knowledge.description: The text examines how communities create outsiders through persistent hostility and morbid fascination. Social exclusion becomes a form of entertainment for the community while causing psychological damage to those marked as different.
knowledge.pattern_connection: The first-person unreliable narration filters community hostility through Merricat's distorted perception, using dramatic irony to reveal the true nature of social cruelty.

device_examples.quote: yellow dishes, I thought, feeling the eyes
device_examples.effect: Contrasts peaceful domestic fantasy with the reality of being constantly watched and judged by hostile community.

device_examples.quote: But if she is a homicidal maniac
device_examples.effect: Reveals how the community treats the family as entertainment while Merricat perceives their visits as normal social interaction.
